title: Zoran Kastel
text:
Zoran Kastel (born 22 October 1972) is a Croatian professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Manager%20%28association%20football%29">manager</a> and former <a href="Football%20player">player</a> who most recently manager of <a href="Croatian%20First%20Football%20League">Prva HNL</a> club <a href="NK%20Vara%C5%BEdin%20%282012%29">Varaždin</a>.
Born in <a href="Vara%C5%BEdin">Varaždin</a>, Kastel joined the youth academy of the local powerhouse <a href="NK%20Vara%C5%BEdin%20%281931%E2%80%932015%29">Varteks</a>. He was promoted to the club's first team squad for the <a href="1998%E2%80%9399%20Prva%20HNL">1998–99 season</a>, and soon established himself as a regular member of the team, appearing in 23 league matches in his debut season. He had appeared in a total of 171 Prva HNL matches and scored 9 goals in his seven and a half seasons with Varteks, before leaving the club to join the <a href="Albanian%20Superliga">Albanian Superliga</a> side <a href="Dinamo%20Tirana">Dinamo Tirana</a> during the winter break of the <a href="2006%E2%80%9307%20Prva%20HNL">2006–07 season</a>. He played for the Albanian powerhouse for a season and a half, before retiring in July 2007.
